content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Intended Lab at Position (0.5, 2.5)
Intended to serve as the research facility for supplying Automation Science Packs. Repeated attempts to craft and place the Lab have failed due to inventory shortages and unmet crafting dependencies. As a result, no Lab structure exists on the map.

### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
Referenced for converting iron ore into iron plates. This pre‐existing furnace is used during the smelting operations; no additional components were assembled into a larger structure.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (-27.0, -60.0)
Referenced for converting copper ore into copper plates. This furnace provided the facility for copper plate production, with resources inserted and output extracted, but no new compound structure was built.

Note: Despite utilizing these production facilities for resource processing, the final map state shows no newly placed entities.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Incorrect API usage for entity retrieval  
 – Avoid using unsupported keywords (e.g. “radius”) or positional arguments with get_entities; adhere strictly to the function’s defined signature.

• Lab placement without confirming inventory  
 – Verify that the Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting placement to prevent “No lab in inventory” errors.

• Unhandled non-iterable returns  
 – When processing the result of get_entities, ensure the value is iterable (e.g. fallback to an empty list if None) to avoid iteration errors.

• Incomplete resource chain for Lab crafting  
 – Ensure all intermediate ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are available. Enhance resource processing (e.g. smelting operations) to fulfill the full set of prerequisites before initiating Lab crafting.

• Repeated lab unavailability  
 – Maintain updated resource inventories and validate crafting dependencies to prevent recurring failures in Lab placement and supply for Automation Science Packs.
